newsitem.title: JORDAN: King Hussein says army must reject "vile" attack.
newsitem.headline: King Hussein says army must reject "vile" attack.

text.p: King Hussein has told leaders of Jordan's armed forces that the killing of seven Israeli schoolgirls by a Jordanian soldier was alien to their military principles.

"This vile and treacherous act is not part of the morals of our Arab army," the official news agency Petra quoted him as saying on a visit to army headquarters on Saturday. "We have never been used to such behaviour in our Arab army."
King Hussein was due to visit Israel on Sunday to pay his condolences to families of the victims.
The king, who has appointed veteran security official Mohammed Kailani to head investigations into the soldier's motives, said Jordan would follow up his findings.
"We must deal with it, either as an individual (act) or if it had consequences and repercussions," the king said.

Jordanian officials have repeatedly said that the soldier, army driver Sergeant Ahmed Mousa Mustafa al-Daqamsa, acted alone. The Daqamsas are from Jordan's East Bank, whose tribes form the bedrock of King Hussein's army.
